experiences.title: API Designer & Developer
experiences.description: Carbon Cash is a Michigan-based startup that rewards students for good energy usage habits. I designed and implemented an API that supported iOS, Android, and client-side Ember web apps, and in addition handled hosting and server maintenance.  The system was built on with Rails, and integrated with local power companies and university housing systems to retrieve data about students' energy usage.

experiences.title: Conference Talk: Service-Oriented Architecture
experiences.description: Based on a client project, I created and delivered a live-coded presentation to introduce people to Service-Oriented Architecture. Designed to help developers break their first service out of a monolithic application, the talk covered inter-process messaging protocols, alternative data stores, and lightweight web frameworks

experiences.title: Web Developer & Research Assistant
experiences.description: Led by Rick Wash, the BitLab at MSU is studying economic trends of crowdfunding sites. As part of the project, the team has built a crowdfunding site for use by MSU students that collects valuable data about how people interact in a crowdfunding marketplace. As the sole developer working on an existing code base, I was responsible for redesigning the site, setting up automated testing, running usability studies, and integrating the site with Amazon Payments.

experiences.title: Vice President and Webmaster
experiences.description: ACM is an international organization that provides resources to students in Computer Science and related fields. As a founding member of the MSU chapter, I helped to organize student events including technology talks and seminars with local tech companies, programming contests, and hackathons. I also gave several presentations about programming and the field of computer science in general.

experiences.title: Medication Shortages Dashboard
experiences.description: Through the senior design program at MSU's computer science department, I worked with doctors and pharmacists at Spectrum Health to create an "issue tracker" for medication shortages. The web application pulled reports of medication shortages from the FDA and gave pharmacists a place to discuss and create plans to outlast the shortages.

experiences.title: Software Engineering Intern
experiences.description: During my three-month internship at Microsoft, I was responsible for developing a testing framework for third-party printer drivers in Windows 8. I worked with team members in the Sustainability Engineering department to create a tool that simplified the verification process for new printer driver submissions.

experiences.title: Digital Evolution Research
experiences.description: The BEACON Lab, based at MSU, studies evolution in a novel way – by observing evolving computer programs. As a research assistant, I was responsible for implementing predator behavior, the ability for programs to feed off of one another.  Working closely with a postdoctoral advisor, I implemented and tested the behavior in C++. The predator-prey features provided a basis for several future publications.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant: Introduction to Programming
experiences.description: As a teaching assistant for the introductory programming course at MSU, I led lab sections and help room hours. Through grading program submissions and helping students one-on-one, I spent many hours teaching programming concepts, techniques, and best practices.

experiences.title: ICT Network Research
experiences.description: In my first research position, I helped a team trying to understand the effects of governmental regulation of ICT networks. Working with a large base of simulation software, I contributed by creating interfaces to visualize the simulated networks.
